title: Welcome to CTCH 204, Introduction to Creative Coding!
text: Welcome to CTCH 204, Introduction to Creative Coding!

title: Getting Started
text:
Entrance Ticket
Look through your classmates’ links in Forum Response 1 | Shapes and Colors in UR Courses. If you notice anything that stands out to you, reply with a comment! Make sure you reply to at least on post.
 OPTIONAL: See if you can figure out which code created the effect you noticed, and include that code in your post.

title: Getting Started
section: You can have a one-week extension on ONE of your first two projects. Otherwise, late work is not accepted.
text: You can have a one-week extension on ONE of your first two projects. Otherwise, late work is not accepted.

title: Getting Started
section: If average grade is too high, everyone might have their grade reduced.
text:
If average grade is too high, everyone might have their grade reduced.
The average grade should be around 70% to avoid a downward curve. Please adjust your grade expecations accordingly.

title: Getting Started
section: You should not come to class if you are sick. You should always come to class if you are well and able.
text: You should not come to class if you are sick. You should always come to class if you are well and able.

title: Getting Started
section: Participation is an important part of your grade.
text:
Participation is an important part of your grade.
This includes speaking in class, attendance, and in-class activities.

title: Getting Started
text:
How to Complete Quiz




Only use the left column
Write your first and last name
Fill in the correct bubble completely!

You can reference the syllabus on UR Courses, or I have a few paper copies. This is the last quiz where you can reference outside materials.

title: Getting Started
Getting Started
text:
() {} []
Parentheses ()
Curly braces {}
Square brackets []
^These always come in pairs! Often, they hold important information. If no information is needed, they are empty, but it’s still important to include both the open and closing symbols.
Curly braces usually hold instructions for functions, loops, conditional statements etc. These instructions always go AFTER the opening brace { and BEFORE the closing brace }.

title: Getting Started
text:
Coordinate Systems

Adrian Piper, Charted Work Proposal for January – December 1969, 1968. Typescript and graph paper with space/time coordinate diagrams under sheet protectors in ring binder

title: Getting Started
section: What’s on the Quiz vs. What’s in Class
text:
What’s on the Quiz vs. What’s in Class
Slides and Coding Train tutorials will include the material you need to know for the next quiz.
Demos may preview more advanced material so that you can see what’s ahead. These may be covered more explicitly for future quizzes, or may be extra material that you can explore on your own.

title: Welcome to 204
text:
Introductions
Let’s go around and introduce ourselves.

Your name
Your pronouns (if you want)
Talk a little bit about why you chose your piece of media
Your name again

title: Welcome to 204
text:
Cartesian Coordinates




Most graphical software uses a Cartesian coordinate system to define where things are on the screen.

title: Welcome to 204
text:
Next class

Next class, we will have a syllabus quiz (you may reference the syllabus). This will be the last quiz where you can look at outside resources. After that, all quizzes will be closed book.

Make sure you bring a pen or pencil! (Note that you should bring a notebook and pen/pencil to every class.)
